{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3422124,"name":"Itay Naumann","username":"Naumann","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/naumann/{size}/225470_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-09T18:55:54.601Z","cooked":"

We started using the VH-109 radio for driver’s practice with it’s access point and we’ve experienced a lot of connection issues, significantly more than with the last radio (losing communications with the driver station).

We are using the radio that we got at champs.
We had set up the access point while following this post’s instructions.

Do other teams experience anything similar?
Is there any solution for the connection issues?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":75,"updated_at":"2024-09-09T18:55:54.601Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":715,"reads":632,"readers_count":631,"score":3751.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":470975,"topic_slug":"vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice","display_username":"Itay Naumann","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/2024-champs-radio-at-home/464481","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"2024 Champs Radio at Home","clicks":52},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/problems-with-connection/471333/2","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Problems with connection","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58868,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1690 Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice/470975/1","custom_user_title":"1690 Software Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3422126,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-09T18:57:47.832Z","cooked":"

The best solution is to not use the 2.4 GHz integrated AP. 2.4 GHz is an incredibly crowded spectrum, so interference is common. Buy a second radio and link up the two at 6 GHz (one on the robot operating in 6 GHz bridge mode, the other on a desk operating in 6 GHz AP mode), and hardwire your laptop(s) into the AP.

yeah we were having the same issue

we’re using the VH-109 practicality as a network switch with it connected to the OPENmesh (yucky) but it works

Itay Naumann:

Do other teams experience anything similar?

We also had somewhat similar issues and went back to the old radio for practice at home, we will probably setup the 6GHz mode eventually since we have 2 of the new radio.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":75,"updated_at":"2024-09-09T19:50:15.775Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":516,"readers_count":515,"score":138.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":470975,"topic_slug":"vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice","display_username":"Emerson OHara","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":43759,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1706 Drive Coach | 9401 Mentor | #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice/470975/4","custom_user_title":"1706 Drive Coach | 9401 Mentor | #TeamThrifty","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3422148,"name":"Cameron (Advanced Programmer)","username":"Juniormunk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/juniormunk/{size}/126866_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-09T19:50:29.368Z","cooked":"

I can say that we also have had issues with this during practice. It is not a unique issue. It seems like you can either set up another radio and use it in 6gzh as Peter said. Or you can set up a wifi 6e router as a network with the wifi name FRC-1690. The radio should automatically connect once you configure your radio with the proper wifi password. You will also want to set the router IP address to 10.16.90.3 and set the DHCP range to 10.16.90.20 to 10.16.90.199 which will set up the router to act as an FMS but for one team. We are working on setting up a multi team FMS network including vlans for around 300$ using used business equipment.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":75,"updated_at":"2024-09-09T19:50:29.368Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":500,"readers_count":499,"score":170.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":470975,"topic_slug":"vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice","display_username":"Cameron (Advanced Programmer)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":35092,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice/470975/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424399,"name":"sam liu","username":"catrix","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/dbc845/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-17T06:41:57.695Z","cooked":"

Can computers with Intel® Wi-Fi 6E AX210 connect to the radio directly?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":75,"updated_at":"2024-09-17T06:41:57.695Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":434,"readers_count":433,"score":111.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":470975,"topic_slug":"vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice","display_username":"sam liu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/products/sku/204836/intel-wifi-6e-ax210-gig/specifications.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":8}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60033,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CE Student @ UWaterloo | 5516 Alum "},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice/470975/6","custom_user_title":"CE Student @ UWaterloo | 5516 Alum ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424404,"name":"Fletcher","username":"FletcherS7","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletchers7/{size}/168995_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-17T06:51:56.031Z","cooked":"

Computers with a 802.11ax or 802.11be (Wi-Fi 6E or Wi-Fi 7) wireless adapter can connect directly to the 6GHz SSID when the VH-109 is in AP mode.

But the VH-109 in AP cannot be powered from battery.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":75,"updated_at":"2024-09-17T06:51:56.031Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":420,"readers_count":419,"score":124.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":470975,"topic_slug":"vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice","display_username":"Fletcher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":60033,"username":"catrix","name":"sam liu","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/dbc845/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25039,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between."},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice/470975/7","custom_user_title":"FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between.","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424405,"name":"Kiet Chau","username":"kiettyyyy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kiettyyyy/{size}/194009_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-17T06:53:28.523Z","cooked":"
Juniormunk:

Or you can set up a wifi 6e router as a network with the wifi name FRC-1690

Just 1690, not FRC-1690. WPA3 with SAE needs to be enabled, WDS also needs to be enabled.

Juniormunk:

multi team FMS network including vlans for around 300$ using used business equipment.

The AP firmware is released allowing the multi VLAN setup using the VH-109 radio.

Good catch. It’s been a few months since I set our up. Our AP didn’t allow for anything other than wpa3 and wds must have been auto configured if that is also required.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":75,"updated_at":"2024-09-17T21:07:37.998Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":334,"readers_count":333,"score":66.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":470975,"topic_slug":"vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice","display_username":"neev dadhania","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":35092,"username":"Juniormunk","name":"Cameron (Advanced Programmer)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/juniormunk/{size}/126866_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57670,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"204 programmer + electrical"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice/470975/10","custom_user_title":"204 programmer + electrical","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3431754,"name":"Josh Sirota","username":"gdgr","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/f1d935/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-10-07T03:33:53.434Z","cooked":"

Reviving this thread rather than starting a new one.

I continue to be frustrated with the VH-109. We continue to put it on the robot, have issues, take it off the robot, upgrade it, test it on the bench (where it works), put it back on the robot, have issues, rinse and repeat.

Maybe we just somehow got a bad one. I don’t know. But it has been frustrating for weeks now.

Our latest consistent issue is that the Rio port seems to not work. If we plug the Rio into it, we see blinky lights but don’t have any connectivity. If we plug the Rio into one of the other ports, then it mostly works. We filed a support ticket with WCP on that one today, because it’s totally consistent and reproducible. To work around that, we have the Rio plugged into one of the Aux ports.

We also have an OrangePi and have that plugged into another aux port. That seemed to be pretty flaky today, though not consistently. Of course, that COULD also be an issue somewhere else in the chain, but we don’t have that issue with the old radio, so I feel like blaming the radio.

The other issue we continue to see fairly frequently is an inability for the DS to connect to the radio’s AP. I know the recommendation here is to buy TWO radios and bridge them but it annoys me that this is the solution because (A) we don’t know that crowded 2.4GHz is the problem, and (B) you want us to spend even more money on this stuff that doesn’t seem quite ready for prime time?

I volunteered at Chezy Champs last weekend and am totally aware that these radios seem to work great at an event, so can’t understand why they are so frustrating in our shop AND at our practice field. Do we just have a dud? I had a great talk with Kiet last weekend at Chezy and totally appreciate everything he’s trying to do, but I still find myself annoyed at the rollout of these things. We had lots of problems with reboots on the field with the old radio, so I’m happy to be able to chuck those things, but I feel like we’re going from one frustrating system to another one. At least with the old ones, we could TEST.

I have students that are passionate about getting the new radio working but I find it just inhibits our ability to test anything else because we have to spend precious time debugging connectivity issues.

So, is the fix to throw MORE money at these things and buy another one? Or do we have a bad radio?

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":75,"updated_at":"2024-10-07T03:33:53.434Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":318,"readers_count":317,"score":83.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":470975,"topic_slug":"vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice","display_username":"Josh Sirota","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56244,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6238 co-lead mentor"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice/470975/11","custom_user_title":"6238 co-lead mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3431775,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-07T04:54:16.969Z","cooked":"
gdgr:

we don’t know that crowded 2.4GHz is the problem

It is definitely a problem re: wireless connectivity (I can’t speak to the wired port issues you’re seeing). 2.4 GHz is not just a crowded spectrum, it also is more susceptible to radio placement, orientation, and dynamic blockages (eg the robot moving around). If you want high quality event-like wireless experience, buy a second radio and run them at 6.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":75,"updated_at":"2024-10-07T04:54:40.062Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":265,"readers_count":264,"score":63.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":470975,"topic_slug":"vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice/470975/12","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3431778,"name":"Carlos Gross Jones","username":"CarlosGJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/carlosgj/{size}/131747_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-07T05:00:50.470Z","cooked":"

Agreed on the first part, but why should be 2.4 GHz be more sensitive to obstacles etc. than 6 GHz? In general, for a given blocker (say, a piece of aluminum box tube), at higher frequencies, the blocker is closer to the wavelength scale. That makes the propagation more raylike and less wavelike, and diffraction is less likely to solve your problems.

This is one why HF propagation can go around mountains and stuff, whereas UHF tends to be line-of-sight.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":75,"updated_at":"2024-10-07T05:00:50.470Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":262,"readers_count":261,"score":72.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":470975,"topic_slug":"vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice","display_username":"Carlos Gross Jones","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16115,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mere hours of work can save you entire minutes of planning"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice/470975/13","custom_user_title":"Mere hours of work can save you entire minutes of planning","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3431783,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-07T05:14:38.454Z","cooked":"

The 6 GHz radio is doing 4x4 MIMO. I’m not sure of all the features the chipset implements, but beamforming is possible with MU-MIMO, and multi-spatial streams alone are probably more robust to robot orientation and multi-path issues. There are only two 2.4 GHz antennas, and I’m not sure MIMO is a thing (at least not to the same extent) with it.

gdgr:

Our latest consistent issue is that the Rio port seems to not work. If we plug the Rio into it, we see blinky lights but don’t have any connectivity.

Are you going directly from Rio to radio with a off the shelf Ethernet cable, and powering the radio via the weidmullers?

I ask because the radio doesn’t ship with a out of the box way to disable the passive PoE backfeed into the Rio. I’m planning surgery on a cat6 cable to cut the PoE lines. Our Rio works fine with the Vbatt backfeeding into those pins, I just want to eliminate edge case weird behavior. Maybe blocking the Vbatt would help you?

If you’re already running PoE in on the Rio port via one of the Rev injectors, this advice won’t apply.

Everything else you’ve described sounds like downstream effects of 2.4Ghz. we have had a very smooth experience at 6 Ghz with a second radio, once we made sure all the suffixes and passwords agreed.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":75,"updated_at":"2024-10-07T05:35:41.650Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":270,"readers_count":269,"score":74.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":470975,"topic_slug":"vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice/470975/17","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3431847,"name":"sanddrag","username":"sanddrag","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/c68b51/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-10-07T12:33:27.359Z","cooked":"

We had very high latency and packet loss when practicing at home. Radio was quite hot. Switched it for another one and all was well, until it got hot and started exhibiting the same symptoms. So, I think at home practice where the radios are powered on for extended durations of time, they are getting heat soaked and throttling themselves to a point at which they’re not functioning correctly anymore.

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":75,"updated_at":"2024-10-07T12:34:11.351Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":271,"readers_count":270,"score":79.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":470975,"topic_slug":"vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice","display_username":"sanddrag","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1082,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice/470975/18","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3431860,"name":"Kiet Chau","username":"kiettyyyy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kiettyyyy/{size}/194009_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-07T13:19:48.283Z","cooked":"
gdgr:

Our latest consistent issue is that the Rio port seems to not work. If we plug the Rio into it, we see blinky lights but don’t have any connectivity.

If you’re running 1.1.2 → 1.2.1 (Chezy Champs release), you might have this problem. Would recommend going to 1.2.2 (was released shortly after).

gdgr:

I know the recommendation here is to buy TWO radios and bridge them but it annoys me that this is the solution because (A) we don’t know that crowded 2.4GHz is the problem

A) The 2.4 GHz radio was added as a “convenience” feature and is not the recommended connectivity path. It was effectively “free” in the design. I mentioned it in other threads, but, the RFFE circuitry was built into the applications processor. If the apps processor gets hot, the first thing to shut down or throttle is the 2.4 GHz portion as we’ve given it extremely low priority. The four 6 GHz RFFE chips are separate with much higher temp ratings and have the highest priority as this is the primary comms path for robots.

gdgr:

(B) you want us to spend even more money on this stuff that doesn’t seem quite ready for prime time?

The radios were run at the 2024 Championship and numerous offseason events after. There have been 0 communications related replays since the introduction of these radios. If anything, we’ve been able to sus out weaker links in the comms chain (poor power connections, ethernet issues, rio issues, etc) as our radio seems to stay linked in most scenarios that certainly disconnect the old radios.

Peter_Johnson:

The 6 GHz radio is doing 4x4 MIMO. I’m not sure of all the features the chipset implements, but beamforming is possible with MU-MIMO, and multi-spatial streams alone are probably more robust to robot orientation and multi-path issues. There are only two 2.4 GHz antennas, and I’m not sure MIMO is a thing (at least not to the same extent) with it.

We disable beamforming as the robots are a bit too fast for this, but, still take advantage of MU-MIMO and 4 spatial streams. We aren’t doing anything fancy on the 2.4 GHz side.

CarlosGJ:

Oh, neat. Is that specific to the VH-109, or is it intrinsic to any 6 GHz radio?

Most 6 GHz devices out there are 2x2 MIMO, limiting you to 2 spatial streams.

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":75,"updated_at":"2024-10-07T13:19:48.283Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":3,"incoming_link_count":67,"reads":276,"readers_count":275,"score":415.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":470975,"topic_slug":"vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice","display_username":"Kiet Chau","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":"Vivid-Hosting","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/5/0/50d2e846f0add7aa9489092abe0f436644dde98d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":62,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/what-do-you-think-about-new-radio/473602/49","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"What do you think about New radio","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CEO @ Vivid-Hosting, Mentor @ Team 1538 / The Holy Cows"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-connection-issues-during-drivers-practice/470975/19","custom_user_title":"CEO @ Vivid-Hosting, Mentor @ Team 1538 / The Holy Cows","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3431914,"name":"Anand Rajamani","username":"asid61","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-07T16:22:41.008Z","cooked":"

Does running it in 2.4GHz mode not disable the 6GHz chips to help prevent heat buildup? Could one perform a surgery to add some kind of heat spreader to the main processor?

People keep talking about the 2.4GHz mode being bad in crowded environments, but I have to wonder if people are conflating that issue with the issue of thermal shutoffs.
